articles.title: Emily C. Zabor
articles.contents:
Emily C. Zabor
          
          
          Tutorials
          Software
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          
          â˜°
          
          
      
        
          
            Emily C. Zabor
          
          
            
              
              I am an Assistant Staff Biostatistician at the
              Cleveland Clinic in the Department of
              Quantitative Health Sciences, with a joint appointment
              in the Taussig Cancer Institute. I also hold an academic
              appointment as Assistant Professor of Medicine at the
              Cleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case
              Western Reserve University.
              My research interests are in clinical trial design and
              statistical methods for observational studies, with
              applications to oncology.
              I earned my MS in biostatistics from The University of
              Minnesota and my DrPH in biostatistics from Columbia
              University.
            
            
              
              I am an Assistant Staff Biostatistician at the
              Cleveland Clinic in the Department of
              Quantitative Health Sciences, with a joint appointment
              in the Taussig Cancer Institute. I also hold an academic
              appointment as Assistant Professor of Medicine at the
              Cleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case
              Western Reserve University.
              My research interests are in clinical trial design and
              statistical methods for observational studies, with
              applications to oncology.
              I earned my MS in biostatistics from The University of
              Minnesota and my DrPH in biostatistics from Columbia
              University.

CRAN packages
ppseq
(author), a package of functions to design clinical trials with
sequential predictive probability monitoring for futility
riskclustr
(author), a package of functions for the study of etiologic
heterogeneity
gtsummary
(contributor) a package for creating presentation-ready summary
tables
Github packages
ezfun, a
package of personal utility functions to generate tables for use in R
Markdown reports
condsurv, a
package for conditional survival analysis

Survival
analysis in R: a detailed tutorial on conducting survival analyses
in R, including an introduction to the basics of survival analysis,
landmark analyses and time-dependent covariates, competing risks, and a
selection of advanced topics.
Creating
websites in R: a basic introduction to creating simple websites in
RMarkdown, using a website for my cats as an example.
